verbs.description: [ARG0: The lawyer] [V: argues] [ARG1: Trump could not have committed obstruction because he has absolute authority over all federal investigations] .
The lawyer argues Trump [V: could] not have committed obstruction because he has absolute authority over all federal investigations .
The lawyer argues Trump could not [V: have] committed obstruction because he has absolute authority over all federal investigations .
The lawyer argues [ARG0: Trump] [ARGM-MOD: could] [ARGM-NEG: not] have [V: committed] [ARG1: obstruction] [ARGM-CAU: because he has absolute authority over all federal investigations] .
The lawyer argues Trump could not have committed obstruction because [ARG0: he] [V: has] [ARG1: absolute authority over all federal investigations] .
